chinese: 1) put sth. into a small space, esp. in order to protect, hide, carry, or hold it 把···放起来
examples: e.g. [[Tuck]] your gloves in your pocket so that you don't lose them.；e.g. The new housekeeper [[tucked]] the bottom of the sheet under the mattress as she was taught to.

chinese: 2) push a loose end of a piece of clothing or material into a particular place or position, esp. to make it tidy or comfortable 把（衣服等的末端）塞进
examples: e.g. [[Tuck]] your gloves in your pocket so that you don't lose them.；e.g. The new housekeeper [[tucked]] the bottom of the sheet under the mattress as she was taught to.

chinese: 1) without any serious interest or attention 不认真的；随便的
examples: e.g. He gave us a [[casual]] glance as he walked by, but didn't stop.；e.g. His eyes were angry, though he sounded [[casual]].

chinese: 2) relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about sth. 漫不经心的；不放在心上的
examples: e.g. He gave us a [[casual]] glance as he walked by, but didn't stop.；e.g. His eyes were angry, though he sounded [[casual]].

chinese: [U] (literary) when interesting or valuable discoveries are made by accident （有趣或有价值事物的）碰巧发现，机缘巧合
examples: e.g. Meeting her like that, and there of all places, was true [[serendipity]]!

chinese: 1) read sth. quickly and eagerly, or watch sth. with great interest 如饥似渴地阅读；津津有味地看
examples: e.g. She spent several evenings [[devouring]] the science fiction books borrowed from the library.；e.g. After the tennis match the boys [[devoured]] the sandwiches in seconds.

chinese: 2) eat sth. quickly because you are very hungry 狼吞虎咽地吃
examples: e.g. She spent several evenings [[devouring]] the science fiction books borrowed from the library.；e.g. After the tennis match the boys [[devoured]] the sandwiches in seconds.

chinese: [pl.] (in the ~ of sth.) (fml.) in the middle of a very difficult situation 处于···的困境中
examples: e.g. The country is presently in the [[throes]] of a profound economic crisis.

chinese: [C, U] (fml.) when sth. changes from one form or state to another 过渡；转变；变迁
examples: e.g. Sometimes, making the [[transition]] from adolescence (青春期) to adulthood can be painful.；e.g. Having been in the position for over 10 years, Jack will finally [[transition]] to his new role next month.

chinese: change to a new state or start using sth. new 过渡；转变
examples: e.g. Sometimes, making the [[transition]] from adolescence (青春期) to adulthood can be painful.；e.g. Having been in the position for over 10 years, Jack will finally [[transition]] to his new role next month.

chinese: [C] the main church of a particular area under the control of a bishop 大教堂；教区总教堂
examples: e.g. The old city around the [[cathedral]] is the most colorful part of town.

chinese: [C] （来自俄语）老婆婆；祖母
[C] 牙刷
(pl. metros) 地铁
showing the true character or nature of sb. / sth., often without being intended 说明问题的；显露真相的
examples: e.g. The tomb stands today as a [[telling]] memorial to the period.

chinese: 1) a piece of information that quickly gives you an idea of what the situation is like at a particular time 简要描述；简介
examples: e.g. The book gives us a [[snapshot]] of life in the Middle Ages.；e.g. He takes [[snapshots]] with a simple camera.

chinese: 2) a photograph taken quickly and often not very skillfully 快照（通常技巧不高）
examples: e.g. The book gives us a [[snapshot]] of life in the Middle Ages.；e.g. He takes [[snapshots]] with a simple camera.

chinese: [U] 资本主义
1) almost; practically 几乎
examples: e.g. He was [[virtually]] unknown in the community before running for office.；e.g. With the new technology, the tour of a museum can be done [[virtually]].

chinese: 2) on a computer, rather than in the real world 虚拟地；模拟地
examples: e.g. He was [[virtually]] unknown in the community before running for office.；e.g. With the new technology, the tour of a museum can be done [[virtually]].

chinese: [C] 化石
1) (usu. passive) become or form a fossil by being preserved in rock （使）成化石，石化
examples: e.g. In Wyoming, I visited a rock shop made entirely of [[fossilized]] dinosaur bones.；e.g. Most couples, however [[fossilized]] their relationship, have some interests in common.

chinese: 2) if people, ideas, systems, etc. fossilize or are fossilized, they never change or develop, even when there are good reasons why they should change（使）（人、思想、体制等）僵化
examples: e.g. In Wyoming, I visited a rock shop made entirely of [[fossilized]] dinosaur bones.；e.g. Most couples, however [[fossilized]] their relationship, have some interests in common.

chinese: relating to or caused by a volcano 火山的；由火山作用引起的
examples: e.g. Geologists understand many of the factors that cause [[volcanic]] eruptions.

chinese: [C] 泥流
1) sth. that makes an unpleasant situation better 缓解方法；对抗手段
examples: e.g. Regular exercise is the best [[antidote]] to tiredness and depression.；e.g. There is no known [[antidote]] to a bite from this snake.

chinese: 2) a substance that stops the effects of a poison 解毒剂
examples: e.g. Regular exercise is the best [[antidote]] to tiredness and depression.；e.g. There is no known [[antidote]] to a bite from this snake.

chinese: [C] the art, profession, or method of producing photographs or the scenes in films 摄影；摄影业；摄影术
examples: e.g. After I went on a [[photography]] course, my friend asked me to take some photos of her.

chinese: 英国维多利亚（女王）时代的
1) sb. whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films, etc.（艺术、音乐、电影等的）评论家，批评家
examples: e.g. The play has been well received by the [[critics]].；e.g. [[Critics]] of the scheme have said that it will not solve the problem of teenage crime.

chinese: 2) sb. who criticizes a person, organization, or idea 批评者
examples: e.g. The play has been well received by the [[critics]].；e.g. [[Critics]] of the scheme have said that it will not solve the problem of teenage crime.

chinese: draw a sketch of sth.（给···）画速写；（给···）画素描
examples: e.g. The art students were told to [[sketch]] the landscape.；e.g. Cantor drew a rough [[sketch]] of his apartment.

chinese: [C] a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail 素描；速写；草图
examples: e.g. The art students were told to [[sketch]] the landscape.；e.g. Cantor drew a rough [[sketch]] of his apartment.

chinese: (jotted, jotting) (~ down) write a short piece of information quickly 草草记下
examples: e.g. Let me [[jot down]] your number and I'll call you tomorrow.

chinese: repeat an idea or opinion because you agree with it 附和（别人的观点）
examples: e.g. I've heard the prime minister's view [[echoed]] throughout the party.；e.g. Her scream was followed by a loud [[echo]].

chinese: (pl. echoes) [C] a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near sth. such as a wall 回声；回音
examples: e.g. I've heard the prime minister's view [[echoed]] throughout the party.；e.g. Her scream was followed by a loud [[echo]].

chinese: 1) showing careful consideration or attention 经缜密思考的；注意的
examples: e.g. It is a [[thoughtful]] and finely acted film, suggesting that no one has a fixed nature.；e.g. It was really [[thoughtful]] of you to remember my birthday.

chinese: 2) always thinking of the things you can do to make people happy or comfortable 想得周到的；体贴的；关心的
examples: e.g. It is a [[thoughtful]] and finely acted film, suggesting that no one has a fixed nature.；e.g. It was really [[thoughtful]] of you to remember my birthday.

chinese: [C] the natural ability, skill, or power that makes a machine, person, or organization able to do sth., esp. sth. difficult（尤指完成困难事情的）能力，才干
examples: e.g. I can speak French, but simultaneous interpretation is beyond my [[capabilities]].

chinese: make a layer of sth. or put sth. down in layers 铺一层···；分层放置
examples: e.g. The cliffs are [[layered]] with fossil remains.；e.g. The moon was shining through a thin [[layer]] of cloud.

chinese: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things 表层；层
examples: e.g. The cliffs are [[layered]] with fossil remains.；e.g. The moon was shining through a thin [[layer]] of cloud.

chinese: (BrE also maximise) increase sth. such as profit or income as much as possible 使增加到最大限度；使最大化
examples: e.g. The aim of everyone, irrespective of weight, should be to change their eating habits to [[maximize]] the health benefits.

chinese: 1) very carefully 仔细地；严密地
examples: e.g. The detective watched him [[closely]], waiting for a reply.；e.g. I have been [[closely]] involved in the work of both committees.

chinese: 2) to a very great degree 密切地；在很大程度上
examples: e.g. The detective watched him [[closely]], waiting for a reply.；e.g. I have been [[closely]] involved in the work of both committees.

chinese: 1) with no information removed （信息）未经过滤的
examples: e.g. The radio station provides millions of people with [[unfiltered]] news.；e.g. [[Unfiltered]] apple juice is such a treat when it's in season in the fall.

chinese: 2) not having had solids removed with a filter 未经过滤的
examples: e.g. The radio station provides millions of people with [[unfiltered]] news.；e.g. [[Unfiltered]] apple juice is such a treat when it's in season in the fall.

chinese: [C] (BrE moustache) hair that grows on a man's upper lip 髭；小胡子
examples: e.g. The old man had wavy hair, wore a thin [[mustache]], and was dressed conservatively.

chinese: [C, U, usu. pl.] a period of thinking carefully about sth. or telling people your thoughts about it 沉思；诉说想法
examples: e.g. We had to sit and listen to his [[musings]] on life.

chinese: if you cherish sth., it is very important to you 重视；珍视
examples: e.g. I [[cherish]] the memory of that day.

chinese: [C] 山羊
[C] a person who can control and train a particular type of animal just by using the voice and gentle body movements, and without using force or threats （通过低声耳语和轻柔的身体动作）训练动物的人
examples: e.g. He's the original horse [[whisperer]]! He could get on the back of any horse in half an hour.

chinese: hit sth. gently, and often repeatedly, esp. making short, sharp noises （常指连续）轻拍，轻叩，轻敲
examples: e.g. Mark [[tapped]] his fingers on the tabletop impatiently.；e.g. I gave her a [[tap]] on the shoulder and she turned around.

chinese: [C] an act of hitting sth. lightly, esp. to get sb.'s attention （尤指为了引起某人注意）轻轻敲击，轻扣，轻拍
examples: e.g. Mark [[tapped]] his fingers on the tabletop impatiently.；e.g. I gave her a [[tap]] on the shoulder and she turned around.

chinese: in a way that feels warm, comfortable, and protected 温暖舒适地
examples: e.g. Jamie was [[snugly]] wrapped in a white woolen scarf.

chinese: [C] a line of colour, esp. one of several lines of color all close together 条纹；线条
examples: e.g. She wore a bright green jogging suit with a white [[stripe]] down the sides.

chinese: having lines or bands of color 有（彩色）条纹的
examples: e.g. The suspect was tall, and wore dark blue trousers with a blue and white [[striped]] shirt.

chinese: continue to exist for a long time 持续存在
examples: e.g. He wasn't the only one who doubted the relationship would [[endure]].；e.g. It seemed impossible that anyone could [[endure]] such pain.

chinese: be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining 忍耐；忍受
examples: e.g. He wasn't the only one who doubted the relationship would [[endure]].；e.g. It seemed impossible that anyone could [[endure]] such pain.

chinese: lasting for a long time 持久的；耐久的
examples: e.g. One of my most [[enduring]] memories is of going on holiday to France with my parents.

chinese: [C] a group of words taken from a text or speech and repeated by sb. other than the original author or speaker 引文；引语；语录
examples: e.g. The following [[quotation]] is taken from a 19th-century travel diary.

chinese: 1) (for sth.'s ~ / for the ~ of it / for its own ~) because of the interest or value sth. has, not because of the advantages it may bring 为某事本身的缘故；鉴于某事本身的价值
examples: e.g. I don't care about winning or losing; I just enjoy playing sports for sports’ [[sake]].；e.g. The family moved to a coastal city in the south for the [[sake]] of the boy's health.

chinese: 2) (for the ~ of sb. / sth.; for sb.'s / sth.'s ~) in order to help, improve, or please sb. / sth. 为了某人 / 某事的缘故
examples: e.g. I don't care about winning or losing; I just enjoy playing sports for sports’ [[sake]].；e.g. The family moved to a coastal city in the south for the [[sake]] of the boy's health.

chinese: do what you are told or expected to do 服从；遵守；顺从
examples: e.g. The little girl made no effort to [[obey]].

chinese: refuse to do what a person, law, order, etc. tells you to do; refuse to obey 不服从；不顺从；违抗
examples: e.g. If you [[disobey]] the law, you will be punished.

chinese: having long sharp points 带尖刺的；有刺的
examples: e.g. Some corals are quite smooth, while others are sharp and [[spiky]].

chinese: [C] 栗子；板栗
[C] （禽蛋、坚果、种子的）壳
[C, U] 桦树；桦木
move slowly from one side to another 摇摆；摇动；摇晃
examples: e.g. The movement of the ship caused the mast (桅杆) to [[sway]] back and forth.

chinese: find or discover sth. by chance and unexpectedly 偶然发现（碰见）
examples: e.g. Workmen [[stumbled upon]] the relic while digging the foundations for a new building.

chinese: (infml.) store sth. esp. money, in a safe place 把（尤指钱）存放在安全处
examples: e.g. The envelope was [[tucked away]] in her jewel box.

chinese: finally succeed or defeat other people or things 终于成功；胜出
examples: e.g. It remains to be seen whether the archaeologists will [[win out]] over the urban planners.

chinese: mention a subject or start to talk about it 提起（话题）
examples: e.g. Why did you have to [[bring up]] the subject of money?

chinese: perhaps even (used to introduce a more extreme term than one first mentioned) 甚至可能（用于提出更极端的说法）
examples: e.g. They cost thousands if not millions of pounds to build.

chinese: (AmE) at once; instantaneously 立刻；实时
examples: e.g. Smart meters show in real time how much electricity and gas is being used by households.

chinese: improve sth. by changing it slightly or adding a little more to it 修改；改进；润色
examples: e.g. We thought the photo had probably been [[touched up]], because he looked so much younger in it.

chinese: start to be successful 开始获得成功；取得进展
examples: e.g. Construction of the theme park never [[got off the ground]] for lack of money.

chinese: make sb. remember sth. or think about it again 使回忆起（想起）
examples: e.g. The photographs [[brought back]] many pleasant memories.

chinese: do as another person did before, esp. in making a journey or following a particular career 步某人的后尘；走某人走过的路；继承事业
examples: e.g. She wanted to follow in her mother's footsteps and be a ballroom dancer.

chinese: 越南（亚洲国家）
胡志明市（越南城市，位于东南部）
俄罗斯（欧洲国家）
俄勒冈州（位于美国西北部）
克拉诺区 （约翰迪化石层国家遗址的三个区块之一）

english: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument
chinese: 约翰迪化石层国家遗址（美国国家公园，位于俄勒冈州）
约翰・罗斯金（英国艺术评论家）
保加利亚（欧洲国家）
维丁（保加利亚城市）
罗伯特・路易・史蒂文森（英国作家）
塞文山脉（位于法国南部）
勒谢拉尔（法国市镇，位于法国南部）
吕克（法国市镇，位于法国南部）
